page.title: 02RIVERS AND ROADS
page.content:
{
The{River Swilgate,}a small tributary of the River Avon winds its way Northwards from Stoke Orchard towards Tewkesbury. It is a small but troublesome river susceptible to {flooding}which like the larger River Avon is a regular annual event. This flooding has caused trouble for many years and was one of the main causes for the death by drowning of so many of Queen Margaret's troops in 1471, at the Battle of Tewkesbury. Two{major roads}cross through the area in a North-South direction; the M5 Motorway in the East of the block and the A38 in the West. The only other roads are minor roads connecting the three villages and the farms to the A38.
